intro: Monnina uribei, commonly known as the redroot sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive seed structures and often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a reddish tint, while the flowers are small and clustered in spikes. Monnina uribei is an annual herb that plays a role in local ecosystems, providing food for various insects and birds.
